src.java.index

Class CSVIndexWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • src.java.index.CSVIndexWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IndexWriter

    public class CSVIndexWriter
extends java.lang.Object
implements IndexWriter
    This implementation of IndexWriter writes an Index object on disk, with a format similar to CSV.
    Example: term, documentId:DocumentFrequency,documentId:DocumentFrequency, ...
    Since:
    10-16-2017
    See Also:
    CSV

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CSVIndexWriter() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void saveIndexToFile(java.lang.String fileName, Index index, java.lang.String tokenizerType)
      The implementation of this function should write in the first line of the file an header that only contains a tag that identifies the Tokenizer that was used to create the @param index.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • CSVIndexWriter

        public CSVIndexWriter()

    • Method Detail

      • saveIndexToFile

        public void saveIndexToFile(java.lang.String fileName,
                            Index index,
                            java.lang.String tokenizerType)
        The implementation of this function should write in the first line of the file an header that only contains a tag that identifies the Tokenizer that was used to create the @param index. After that, the @param index itself should be written.
        Specified by:
        saveIndexToFile in interface IndexWriter
        Parameters:
        fileName - The of the file where the index will be written.
        index - The Index object to be written on disk.
        tokenizerType - A tag that represents the type of Tokenizer that was used in the indexation process. This tags are located in Constants.
